entry.value: # This example relies on ggplot2 and grid, if these packages are not part of %%00010# your R installation, please add them!%%00010require(ggplot2)%%00010require(grid)%%00010%%00010# Insert column references here. %%00010# Note: variable names are used as plot labels ("x" will be the x axis label)%%00010%%00010Score = knime.in$"ColumnValues"%%00010Attribute = knime.in$"Var"%%00010%%00010#Column to color by:%%00010%%00010Class = knime.in$"case"%%00010Significance = knime.in$"Significant"%%00010# Use a flow variable for a title%%00010%%00010title = "Tree Ensemble Feature Selection"%%00010%%00010alpha = scale_alpha(range = c(0.4,1))%%00010%%00010# define a plot theme%%00010# http://docs.ggplot2.org/0.9.2.1/theme.html for more options%%00010clean_theme = theme(plot.title = element_text(size=20, face="bold", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009panel.border = element_rect(color = "black", linetype = "solid", fill = "transparent"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.title.x = element_text(size=14, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.title = element_text(size=14, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009axis.text = element_text(size=12, face="italic", colour = "black"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009legend.text = element_text(size=12, face="italic", colour = "black")%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009)%%00010%%00010# Generate a plot and apply the theme%%00010qplot(Score, Attribute, color = Class, main = title) + clean_theme #+ alpha

entry.key: Output non numbers (NaN, Inf, -Inf) as missing cells
